intro: Erigeron oligodontus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that transition to white as they mature. Erigeron oligodontus is often used in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
